docs.text: house on haunted hill ( 1999 ) starring taye diggs , geoffrey rush , ali larter , famke janssen , peter gallagher , bridgette wilson , max perlich , lisa loeb , james marsters , and chris kattan .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: directed by william malone , written by dick beebe ,
docs.label: negative

docs.text: " house on haunted hill " initializes itself to the audience with a scene involving zombie-like mental patients attacking and murdering doctors in the goriest ways possible .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: one doctor is killed instantly after having a pencil rammed completely through his neck .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: a nurse has her head forced into a barrel of water .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: these mobs of zombies presented are like those in previous b-horror flicks , with grunting noises and cadaverous movements .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: except this time , at the end of the millenium , the film is given the power to show exactly how horrific these creatures can be .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: in past horror films , the actual murder scenes are left out or not shown forcing the viewer to assume their own nasty bloody deaths for the hapless victims .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: " house on haunted hill " doesn't want their audience to have an imagination , everything is provided for them to watch and squirm , not think .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: this nonsense violence thrown out of nowhere is unfortunately the most refreshing part about this film .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: " house on haunted hill " , which is based on the 1958 film of the same title , introduces a handful of characters as quickly as it can , following the opening blood fest .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the film has no intention of providing character development or a laudable plot .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the aim here is to scare the audience with chilling , unexpected shots of blood , guts , and mayhem .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: however , the film is neither scary nor unpredictable .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the plot involves five people who are dared to spend the night in a haunted house for one million dollars by an amusement park owner ( geoffrey rush ) .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: each character is a failure in the external world and acknowledges that they would do anything for that money .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: since the characters are immediately generalized as either greedy or caring , the expectations of who will survive or not is killed five minutes after you meet them .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the problem is that every character is not likable .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the two who come closest to being civilized are a womanizer ( taye diggs - who should be doing films a lot better than this with all of his talent ) and a businesswoman who accepts being womanized ( ali larter ) .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the characters presented are so annoying and pathetic , that it is hard to cheer for them or scream them .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the worst character in this film , or maybe in any film released this year , is chris kattan's watson pritchett .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: he spends the whole film whining about the spooky house in a tone so irritating and inappropriate , that he unintentionally begins to seem more evil than the house itself .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: waiting for pritchett to die , was a strenuously difficult act to sit through .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the most humorous actor of the bunch is geoffrey rush playing steven price ( an homage to victor price who starred in the original ) .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: playing the rich man who supposedly organized the party , he plays the role perfectly in a twisted way where it is obvious that he is up to something just by the expressions on his face .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: however , rush is pretty much wasted in a confusing subplot involving a hateful marriage with evelyn price , played by famke janssen .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the main problem is that " house on haunted hill " is not scary .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: to top off that huge disappointment , every actor was wasted and the script was completely ludicrous .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: if the annoying characters and hilariously bad dialogue were intentionally underdeveloped ( similar to " deep blue sea " ) , the goal for creating a creepy , suspenseful action film was completely missed .
docs.label: negative
